posts.author: Ethalox
posts.content:
Greetings, builders.
So far, I have had a good experience reading through your forum, so I will
request another inspiration that I can hold up to what I have tried to construct, so here we go.

Restrictions: Level 30 cap, 3 "Gifts" (Boons that allow +2 to any stat, post-character creation), 3 consecutive levels must follow the introduction of a new class, no HiPS, no Devastating critical, no RDD, no Shifter, low magic items .
Intended race: Human
Preferences: I could both go for melee or range, strength and dex, but I envision a bard without too hefty armor. The concept is that of a lorekeeper, so high skill in lore
is a requirement. I would also be keen to have high hide / MS, so a dex based character is what I am hoping for. Take note that armor, up to scale armor and large shield, is avaliable in "caster" colors: Custom armor with no arcane spell failure. Furthermore, -NO BLACKGUARD- levels. Bards can be lawful on Arelith, so paladin (though I would rather stick to true neutral allignment) is an option.

So far, I have considered a build along the lines of 16 bard / 14 rogue, dualwielding shortswords or using a shortsword and shield, with weapon finesse and epic dodge.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Wow! Allowing Bards to be lawful opens up such possibilities! While I understand the CHA synergy with Bard / Paladin, I am more excited by the idea of Bard / Monk. That's a shame about RDD, which really adds a lot to a build.

Here are some ideas:

Bard 18 / Monk 6 / Fighter 6 dual-wielding kamas.
Rogue 6 / Bard 18 / Fighter 6 either dual-wielding or sword-and-board (or take the dual-wielding feats and switch to either mode as needed for the situation).
Bard 12 / AA 18
Bard 16 / DD 14
Bard 10 / Fighter 6 / DD 14
Bard 10 / Fighter 10 / PM 10
Bard 16 / Fighter 4 / CoT 10

Pick a couple (up to 3) and I'll build 'em for you.

posts.author: Ethalox
posts.content:
Really interesting combinations. Are they all dex based? I have cut away the restrictive ones (PM, because necromancy would not fit the character, DD for the race),
but I would like to hear more about the builds before I cut away the last one - Particularly about the monk and AA variations. What are their pros and cons? How do you picture they will hold up? It is possible through gear and potions to reach the +12 stat cap in 2 stats, for reference, and the best weapons avaliable are +3 AB, +6 slashing / piercing / bludgeoning damage, +4 of a damage type of your choice (Though not slashing, piercing ect.), as well as a 1d6 temporary damage essence with similar properties - These are affordable and stick with the weapon for a while, so it is safe to include in one's calculations. These weapon properties are similar to all weapons, two- and onehanded weapons alike. How come the Rogue / Bard variation (14/16, potentially) is not amongst those you deem interesting?
Empyre65 wrote:
Bard 18 / Monk 6 / Fighter 6
Rogue 6 / Bard 18 / Fighter 6
Bard 12 / AA 18
Bard 16 / Fighter 4 / CoT 10

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Yes, they're all DEX based. I didn't notice that you wanted only Human, so that leaves AA out because it has to be an Elf.

The Monk version has more attacks per round, which is a big deal when you have so much damage on your weapons, and also free Cleave, Improved Knockdown, Monk Speed, +1 AC, and immunity to disease.

The Rogue version was not really eliminated, but modified to have Fighter to get that 4th attack per round. If you want more Rogue, another variation would be Rogue 10 / Bard 12 / Fighter 8.

posts.author: Ethalox
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:Yes, they're all DEX based. I didn't notice that you wanted only Human, so that leaves AA out because it has to be an Elf.
I could settle for half-elf, which makes the class avaliable, still.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
An AA can get higher AB than any other class, even WM. Also, 18 levels of AA can bypass up to X/+9 damage reduction, as if it isn't there at all. That build would add +9 to your attack rolls and +9 (piercing) to your damage. However, using Half-Elf instead of Elf loses the +2 DEX bonus and other Elf racial bonuses, while also losing the Human bonus feat and skill points.

I'll be back this evening to build the builds you choose.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
As the damage bonuses on weapons start to increase, you'll find that adding weapon master into the mix will really crank up your damage.

In your case, with three +6 physical damage bonuses and +4 of your choice (assuming it's elemental or magical type), that's 22 damage bonus (I'll assume the 1d6 essence is an on hit property and doesn't get multiplied by crits) plus some from the base weapon, so the extra +1 WM crit multiplier is good for an extra ~25 damage per hit, which is pretty nice on a DEX character. I have a nice lvl 40 version of Bard 20 WM16 Ftr 4 that has worked really well for me. I'll modify a lvl30 version and post it here, something like bard 17 wm7 FTR6.

I think in some of the builds above, you're going to want to sub toughness or Luck of Heros for Knockdown and possibly make room for IKD.

If you go the rogue path, I'd either take enough rogue to get Epic dodge, or go with something like the first build Empyre posted because I think you'll find the +3 AC/-3 AC to enemies from lvl16 Bard/Curse Song more valuable than rogue levels 7-10. But that's just me.
